paragraph.paragraph: The 2.5 release of EiffelEnvision brings with it a wealth of improvements and enhancements to features present in previous releases of Eiffel ENViSioN! as well as a number of additions. The items mention here are only some of the major additions and improvements made to EiffelEnvision. For a complete taxonomy of changes in EiffelEnvision, please review the history/versions/eiffelenvision_25.xmlEiffelEnvision 2.5 Version History document.
The first notable change is that EiffelEnvision has had a name change. In previous release EiffelEnvision was known as Eiffel ENViSioN! (Eiffel for .NET for Visual Studio .NET).

One of the biggest changes in EiffelEnvision 2.5 is a change in the way projects, and their files, are managed and configured. Projects are now subdiveded into 4 logical sections creating a clear distinction between project component reference, project files and items, Eiffel libraries and a group of miscellane items. In addition, project ../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/30_type_organization.xmlCluster management, used to manage ../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/20_language/10_eiffel_classes.xmlEiffel Class source files, has been integrated directly into the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfSolutionExplorerDialog.htmSolution Explorer, providing the simpliest and most direct means possible of file management.

The way projects are configured has also changed. EiffelEnvision 2.5 abstracts a number of Project Configuration Properties to create a set of Common Properties in order to faciliate users in configuring projects faster and with less errors when changing between vxconBuildConfigurations 0 Build Configurations . In addition to this abstraction, a number of project Configuration Properties have been added, such as Eiffel ../using_eiffelenvision/compiling_projects/debug_clauses.xmlDebug Clauses and advanced properties to tweak compilation.

EiffelEnvision has had many improvements and optimizations made to the ../using_eiffelenvision/compiling_projects/compiling_projects.xmlBuild/Compilation process. EiffelEnvision projects build faster than ever before. Not only has the Eiffel compiler been enhanced to compile your Eiffel for .NET source files, but EiffelEnvision has a new build-as-needed mechanism. EiffelEnvision projects are now compiled as required, allowing ../using_eiffelenvision/eiffelenvision_projects/adding_projects/projects.xmlEiffel Class Library projects to be added to your vxurfSolutionExplorerDialog 0 Solution without penalty. Regular projects also benefit from being built-as-needed; compilations are smaller and require less overall compilation time or sometimes require no compilation at all.
For changes to the Eiffel compiler, please see ../../eiffelstudio/reference/30_compiler/60_version_history/index.xmlEiffel Compiler Version History

The ../using_eiffelenvision/eiffel_editor/index.xmlEiffel Editor has been vastly improved and enhanced over previous versions of Eiffel ENViSioN!. The editor is now an vcovrAutomaticStatementCompletion 0 Intellisense feature complete editor, and comes complete with a ../using_eiffelenvision/eiffel_editor/browse_and_navigation.xmlfeature_listFeature Index List and fully automatic ../using_eiffelenvision/eiffel_editor/browse_and_navigation.xmloutlining_codeSource Code Outlining. In addition to these new features, the ability to ../using_eiffelenvision/eiffel_editor/browse_and_navigation.xmlsync_class_viewSynchronize Class View has been added and ../using_eiffelenvision/eiffel_editor/browse_and_navigation.xmlgo_to_definitionGo To Defintion and ../using_eiffelenvision/eiffel_editor/intellisense.xmlCompletion have been greatly improved to produce better results.

With the new revision of the whats_new.xmlsolution_explorerSolution Explorer, EiffelEnvision integrates more seamlessly with deconUsingSourceCodeControl 0 Source Code Control . Management of your project's source files can be controlled from within Visual Studio .NET and EiffelEnvision automously. There are no more additional configuration files to concern yourself with, and nothing else you have to consider when intergrating EiffelEnvision projects into a deconUsingSourceCodeControl 0 Source Code Control controlled repository.

EiffelEnvision projects now provide even more to the integrated Visual Studio .NET DALGProjects 0 Setup and Deployment Projects . With better dependency evaluation and more deployment options available, ../using_eiffelenvision/deploying_projects/index.xmldeploying projects created using EiffelEnvision is now simpler than ever.

New to EiffelEnvision 2.5 is the ../using_eiffelenvision/eiffelenvision_for_eiffelstudio_developers/conversion_tool/index.xmlEiffelStudio to EiffelEnvision Project Conversion Tool. The tool replaces the Import from EiffelStudio project in previous versions of Eiffel ENViSion!. The tool integrates into the Windows shell providing conversion directly from Windows Explorer. The tool is also much more feature rich than it predecessor, allowing both classic Eiffel and Eiffel for .NET projects to be converted/imported into EiffelEnvision with the push of a button.

There are many, many more additions, enhancements and improvements in EiffelEnvision 2.5, which through reading this documentation, or using EiffelEnvision, you will discover. EiffelEnvision will be intuitive for those who have used Visual Studio .NET before and have a knowledge of the ../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/index.xmlEiffel Langauge. For those who have not used Visual Studio .NET before should become accustomed to the plethora of features it provides, which EiffelEnvision integrates into and expands upon.Those who have not yet used Eiffel and this is your introduction to it, then it is recommended you become familar with the ../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/20_language/index.xmlEiffel Langauge and read ../../../general/guided_tour/language/invitation-00.xmlAn Invitation to Eiffel.

We sincerley hope you enjoy the new features of EiffelEnvision 2.5,
EiffelEnvision 2.5 Team.
